Trial_Design.evidence: previously randomized to adjuvant chemoradiation after surgery or surgery alone

Participants.evidence: a sample of 448 surgical survivors with stage IB through IV (M0) gastric and gastroesophageal junction adenocarcinoma

Intervention.evidence: randomized to adjuvant chemoradiation after surgery or surgery alone

Objective.evidence: to measure the effect of hospital surgical volume, as assessed by Medicare claims data, on overall survival and gastric cancer recurrence

Method_Outcome.evidence: hospital surgical volume was not predictive of overall survival ( P = 0.46) or disease-free survival ( P = 0.43) at a median follow-up of 8.9 years

Result_Outcome.evidence: an adjusted hazard ratio of 0.80 (95% CI, 0.53–1.20) for overall survival and 0.78 (95% CI, 0.53–1.14) for disease-free survival
